content.description: This was cleaned last summer. Start on the left side of the primary north face, utilizing bumps and some rails/crimps on the main face.
content.protection: Pads and a good spotter or two. The landing is good, minus the tree, but the problem is still tall.
content.location:
This starts on the left side of the north face. The rock quality is good overall. There's a "flake" in the center of the problem that we thought would be questionable but was really what helped make the problem.

The downclimb is on the west side of the boulder. It's a little convoluted, but you "slide" down the ramp and then downclimb the 5.7 final section. It's not terrible, but you also aren't just walking off.
